column4: ï»¿I have a Broadcom BCM4306 and so far from some guides I've found I managed to get it to show the wireless access points around me. However I have yet yo be able to CONNECT to any of them. Is there something I'm missing or that I have to do? (installed bcm43xx-fwcutter to get this far)
are you using HH?
yes
Use the Broadcom B43 driver under Administration > Hardware Drivers
Make sure "Enabled" is checked and that you are connected to the Internet over a LAN connection
didn't work
what didn't work about it?  Is that one showing 'Enabled' and 'In use'?
yes. I still can't connect to the internet through the access points though
can you see them?
yes
have you rebooted since updating the driver?   Sounds Windows-like, but worked for me.
like 3 times now, but it hasn't been showing that box in that hardware screen till now
well if you just checked it, and installed the hardware, reboot and see if you can connect.
are the networks WPA or WEP?  Can you connect to non-encrypted ones/
unencrypted
have you tried another network?
there are no other networks in this area
nope reboot didn't work
well in order to rule out another problem, you might want to go somewhere that there is.  Can you reboot the wireless router that you are trying to connect to?
it isn't the router, I'm connected with a different computer to that router right now and it works fine. I tried connecting to another network that's across the street but that didn't work either
I would still recommend rebooting the router if you have access.   Have you tried connecting to the other network since installing the B43 driver?
just tried both of those, neither worked
Don't know what to tell you then... you could try setting a static IP to see if it's a DHCP problem
